talks.title: Intermediate Flask
talks.description: Written as a natural extension of the my Accelerated Introduction to Web Development talk, this tutorial covers advanced topics in Flask, including building large Flask apps, managing dependencies, using a database, and processing form data.

talks.title: Learn to Learn to Program
talks.description: Learning to program can be intimidating. This talk attempts to outline everything you need to do and know in order to learn to program.

talks.title: An Accelerated Introduction to Web Development
talks.description: This talk walks through all of the steps to learning to build your first web application. It covers Python, Flask, APIs, HTML, and CSS.

talks.title: When “Awesome” is Isolating
talks.description: Too often, hackathon organizers focus on making their events “awesome”. However, this often results in losing sight of how to attract new members, grow our communities, and focus on learning. DevFest, Columbia's week-long workshop series and hackathon focus on education, community, and building. I gave this talk at HackCon in February, 2014.

talks.title: Making Windows Work
talks.description:
Tired of people making fun of you for using Windows? Come on down to learn how to put the “Win” back in “Windows”! Get the spark back, with cool tips and tricks that"ll wonder how you ever lived without!

Learn how to:

  • Develop and Collaborate effectively
  • Manage without a package manager
  • Command Prompt like a pro
  • Multitask with ease Bring your laptops!

talks.title: The Power of Video Game Design
talks.description:
The traditional discussion of the role of video games in our culture is misguided. Can we think about video games differently?

This talk was influenced by Jane McGonigal's book Reality Is Broken.
